datafield.subfield: Arthur Laurents (1917-2011) was an American playwright, screenwriter and Broadway director. The collection, which documents his life and career, includes scripts, correspondence, datebooks, photographs, book drafts, production notes, programs, publicity materials, business papers, awards, clippings, and articles.

titlestmt.author: Processed by the Music Division of the Library of Congress

seriesstmt.titleproper: Guides to Special Collections in the Music Division of the Library of Congress

note.p: Contact information: http://hdl.loc.gov/loc.music/perform.contact
Catalog Record: http://lccn.loc.gov/2012563811

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Library of Congress Music Division, 2012

did.head: Collection Summary
did.abstract: Arthur Laurents (1917-2011) was an American playwright, screenwriter and Broadway director. The collection, which documents his life and career, includes scripts, correspondence, datebooks, photographs, book drafts, production notes, programs, publicity materials, business papers, awards, clippings, and articles.

note.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the Library's online catalog. They are grouped by name of person or organization, by subject or location, and by occupation and listed alphabetically therein.

controlaccess.head: Places
controlaccess.geogname: Broadway (New York, N.Y.)--Social life and customs.
Hollywood (Los Angeles, Calif.)--Social life and customs.

processinfo.head: Processing History
processinfo.p: The Arthur Laurents Papers were processed by Gina Bombola, Christopher Bowen, Cara Duggan, and William Robin in 2012. Christopher Hartten coded the finding aid for EAD format in 2012.

separatedmaterial.head: Transfers
separatedmaterial.p: Sound and video recordings from the Arthur Laurents Papers have been transferred to the Library of Congress Motion Picture, Broadcasting and Recorded Sound Division. An inventory of this material is available in the Music Division's collection file.

separatedmaterial.head: Other Repositories
separatedmaterial.p: Additional materials can be found in the Arthur Laurents Collection at Brandeis University.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Photographs, correspondence, scripts, and newspaper clippings pertaining to Arthur Laurents can be found in the Library of Congress Music Division's Leonard Bernstein Collection (ML31.B49) and Jerry Herman Collection (ML31.H467).

userestrict.head: Copyright Status
userestrict.p: Materials from the Arthur Laurents Papers are governed by the Copyright Law of the United States (Title 17, U.S.C.) and other applicable international copyright laws.

accessrestrict.head: Access and Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The Arthur Laurents Papers are open to research. Researchers are advised to contact the Music Division prior to visiting in order to determine whether the desired materials will be available at that time.
Certain restrictions to use or copying of materials may apply.

altformavail.head: Electronic Files
altformavail.p: Electronic files were received as part of the Arthur Laurents Papers. Consult reference staff in the Performing Arts Reading Room for more information.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: [item, date, container number], Arthur Laurents Papers, Music Division, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.

eventgrp.event: Remained stateside and wrote training films and radio plays for the Army

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The Arthur Laurents Papers span from around 1900-2011, with the majority of the materials dating from 1960 to 2011. The collection includes scripts for various theatrical works, correspondence, business papers, published and unpublished writings, photographs, biographical materials, datebooks, and other materials.

The Project Files series consists mostly of script drafts for various stage works in addition to correspondence, business papers, photographs, and other materials related to these productions. Included in the collection of nearly forty musicals, plays and screenplays are West Side Story, Gypsy and Hallelujah, Baby!. Novelizations or novelistic treatments of his works The Way We Were, The Turning Point, and The Enclave are present as well. There are also working scripts from productions that Laurents directed, including La Cage aux Folles. Although the majority of correspondence from notable personalities is filed separately, some letters from collaborators, including Stephen Sondheim, are also found among the project files.

The Correspondence series includes personal and business letters, telegrams, postcards, and other communications gathered throughout Laurents' career. He moved in Hollywood and Broadway circles for over 60 years and accumulated a vast number of contacts and friends. Notable figures of twentieth-century theatre and film with whom he communicated include, Leonard Bernstein, Stephen Sondheim, Alfred Hitchcock, Robert Redford, Jerome Robbins, Richard Rodgers, Barbra Streisand, and Patti LuPone. He also corresponded with major figures at institutions such as Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Walt Disney Studios, and Columbia Pictures. Laurents' personal correspondence with certain individuals, including Tom Hatcher and Millie Rowland, takes place over decades and offers insights into his personal life.

The Writings series chiefly contains drafts of Laurents's published autobiography and memoir, Original Story By: A Memoir of Broadway and Hollywood and Mainly on Directing: Gypsy, West Side Story and Other Musicals respectively. This series also includes drafts of a third unpublished memoir, The Rest of the Story, as well as interviews and articles by and about Laurents. The Photographs series chiefly consists of portraits and miscellaneous headshots of Laurents that span the playwright's life, from only several months old until the year of his death in 2011. This series also contains old family photographs, images of Laurents with other people, and photographs of his lovers Farley Granger and Tom Hatcher. There are also a large number of negatives, both developed and undeveloped. Those negatives that have been developed and are present in the collection have been identified as such.

A small series of Biographical Materials contains various documents pertaining to Laurents' other life activities. These include biographical notes for programs, his FBI Freedom of Information Act File, a living will, Army records and Cornell University materials. The Datebooks series contain bound volumes that chart Laurents' daily activities from 1954 to 2011. The Miscellany series includes housing contracts, assorted business materials, awards, memorials, and several folders of research materials that Laurents prepared on the various decades of the twentieth century.

arrangement.head: Organization of the Arthur Laurents Papers
arrangement.p: The Arthur Laurents Papers are organized in seven series:

scopecontent.p: Script drafts, correspondence, contracts, production notes, programs, technical drawings, publicity materials, photographs, and other materials related to various stage works. All files contain at least one script unless otherwise noted. Correspondence from collaborators is interfiled with their respective projects.

arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by title of project.

scopecontent.p: Letters, telegrams, postcards, notes, and other communications from notable personalities, sent and received by Laurents. Many folders have enclosed clippings, programs, photographs, and other materials.

arrangement.p: Chiefly arranged alphabetically by last name of correspondent.

scopecontent.p: Chiefly draft materials for Original Story By: A Memoir of Broadway and Hollywood and Mainly on Directing: Gypsy, West Side Story and Other Musicals. Also included are interviews, articles, essays, and a variety of writings about Laurents by others.

arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by title or subject.
